Hubspot Project Manager – Web Design and Marketing at Intechnic

Remote

Location: Chicago 60606 United States

Intechnic is an international UX & Web Design Agency helping customer-centric companies improve the user experience of websites to attract, engage, and retain customers. We are looking for an enthusiastic Web Project Manager with extensive experience with HubSpot (HubSpot certified) to manage website projects from inception and strategy, to wireframes, design and implementation (on HubSpot).

Summary:

As a HubSpot Web Project Manager, you will be entrusted with all aspects of a timely delivery of website projects on HubSpot to clients by managing prototyping, design, development, and deployment of website projects. This requires coordination of internal and external resources, time management and planning, budgeting and resource allocation, quality assurance, customer communications, and everything required to deliver a successful project on time and on budget. The position also includes supporting existing customers on HubSpot, helping with ongoing website/marketing needs, as well as managing Intechnic’s own various HubSpot assets, needs and blog on Intechnic’s own website (www.intechnic.com).

Objectives:

Delivering results-driven HubSpot solutions to clients on time, while exceeding clients’ expectations, meeting objectives and maintaining profitability.

Responsibilities:

  1. Manage all aspects of deploying website projects on HubSpot.
  2. Manage and coordinate communications with the client and everyone on the project.
  3. Coordinate and manage a team of UX designers, graphic designers, coders and other professionals working on various projects.
  4. Participate in and apply research findings, including project kick-off workshops, customer interviews, personas and customer journeys, competitive research, etc.
  5. Manage schedules, work assignments, status reports, project budgets, scope of work, milestones, risks, change controls, etc.
  6. Responsible for completing projects within prescribed resource limits and in accordance with client requirements and established processes.
  7. Responsible for developing marketing strategies and implementing tactics using HubSpot throughout each project.
  8. Assisting customers with miscellaneous HubSpot-related questions, needs, and challenges.
  9. Be able to understand evolving business and marketing challenges and opportunities and offer solutions or improvements.
  10. Effectively manage clients’ expectations throughout the projects.
  11. Measure and track project KPIs; report to the client on the project’s success.
  12. Continually improve project’s outcome and efficiencies by implementing new processes, technologies, and tools.
  13. Review and prepare SOWs (statements of work), documentation, quotes, and manage customers’ expectations.
  14. Help manage Intechnic’s own HubSpot assets (landing pages, CTAs, workflows, etc.), as well as maintain Intechnic’s blog (https://www.intechnic.com/blog)
  15. Proactively stay on top of HubSpot new features and offerings, maintain certifications and take additional training (as necessary).

Qualifications:

  1. At least 5+ years of project management with a UX or web design / web development firm (other areas of project management WILL NOT be considered).
  2. At least 3+ years of building, managing, and running websites on HubSpot.
  3. Multiple HubSpot certifications (All areas of HubSpot Software, Inbound, Content Marketing, GDD, Email Marketing, etc.). Be able to provide certification credentials for verification.
  4. Proficient/Expert knowledge of HubSpot (able to demonstrate), including but not limited to:
    1. Contacts, Companies and List Management
    2. E-mail (templates, automatic, mailing blast)
    3. Social
    4. Landing Pages
    5. Blog
    6. SEO
    7. Forms & CTAs
    8. Workflows & Sequences
    9. Analytics & Reports
  5. Completed project management training and/or certifications.
  6. Have a proven track record as a project manager on medium to large web projects.
  7. Ability to demonstrate completed web projects (portfolio), accomplished business results and explain the role played in these projects.
  8. Have solid technical understanding of the UX and web technologies, marketing, processes and solutions behind these projects.
  9. Ability to demonstrate an in-depth understanding of business processes.
  10. Familiarity with common CMS platforms and frameworks (HubSpot, WordPress, Drupal, Joomla, Sitecore, Magento, etc.)
  11. Familiarity with common web project management & collaboration tools (Jira, Basecamp, Trello, Slack, Invisionapp, Smartsheet, etc.)
  12. Have excellent team management, communications, people and written skills.
  13. Have excellent problem solving, organization, and time management skills.
  14. Ability to research, learn quickly and on your own.
  15. Experience managing vendors/partners remotely (provide examples).
  16. Experience with Agile framework (SCRUM)

Attributes:

  1. 100% complete ownership attitude/mindset
  2. Attention to detail
  3. Problem solving skills
  4. Creativity and ability to think “outside the box”
  5. Strategic thinking
  6. Analytical skills
  7. Excellent organization & time management skills
  8. Pursuit of excellence
  9. High level of energy
  10. Up to date with various web design trends and technology
  11. Understanding of business
  12. Understanding of marketing concepts and methodology
  13. Quick learner
  14. Excellent leadership skills
  15. Flexible & adaptive

Why Should You Work @ Intechnic?

  1. Work remotely from anywhere in the US
  2. Flexible schedule
  3. Great environment for problem solvers
  4. Continual professional growth through coaching and training
  5. Obtain certification
  6. Competitive salary & benefits
  7. Work directly with the founder
  8. Opportunities to travel (including internationally)
  9. Fast-paced environment
  10. Interesting projects that excite & inspire
Apply for job

Arc is changing the way the world works and hires remotely. We are looking for a Head of Sales with hands-on experience building and scaling sales organizations to help accelerate Arc’s growth. 

Join a fast-growing 30-person company backed by prominent investors. Our team members are based all over the world (SF Bay Area, North America, and Asia). This is a remote position (of course) - since Arc is all about lowering the friction of hiring remote.

items.title: Director of Expense Administration
items.content:
Director of Expense Administration at MoveCenter

Remote

Due to growth, we are looking for an exceptional person to add to our staff. This person can office at our headquarters in San Mateo, CA or work remotely from a home office within the USA.

This position will be available to clients, transferees and coworkers with flexible office hours. This requires working beyond a standard work week throughout the year with more hours during peak busy seasons, which may or may not fall during Summer, depending on clients’ program needs.

We are seeking a talented individual equally capable of conversing with clients who are experts in relocation accounting and payroll processes as well as those with basic questions because they are relocating an employee for the first time. You will be responsible for a wide variety of tasks and accuracy is paramount. You need to be self-motivated, highly organized and have a keen sense of priorities and time-management.

Below is a sample list of tasks a Director of Expense Administration may perform:

  • Assist the business development team during sales cycles with information regarding gross-up policies, expense taxability per IRS rules and regulations, and other information as needed.
  • Set up the MoveTrack technology system by Ineo to meet client requirements pertaining to gross-up methodology, GL codes, ad-hoc expense and payroll reporting.
  • Audit of relocation related expenses for the following: inclusion in relocation policy or approval by exception, accuracy, taxability, and relevancy to relocation. This function includes data entry into the MoveTrack technology system, and communicating with clients and Relocation Consultants regarding issues, corrections, or concerns related to expenses via phone and email.
  • Preparation of accurate payroll reporting for clients which may or may not include gross-up calculations. These reports happen per a schedule determined by the client and may also include quarterly and year-end reconciliation reports along with Relocation Tax Report preparation and distribution.
  • Additional expense reporting based on the clients’ requests during the year. This function can include pre-determined scheduled reporting, one-time ad-hoc report requests, and quarterly, semi-annual, or annual client review meetings preparation and attendance.
  • Assist in the preparation of client invoices.
  • Assisting clients and other MoveCenter staff in understanding or explaining gross-up policies, expense taxability per IRS rules and regulations, management report requests, and other duties or requests deemed appropriate by management.
  • Other duties as required.

Preferred Skills:

  • Familiar with MS Office
  • Home office / remote working experience (if not located in San Mateo, CA).
  • Bachelor’s degree; however, related experience in relocation will be considered in lieu of formal education.

Required Skills:

  • Proficient with MoveTrack by Ineo.
  • Outstanding communication, interpersonal, listening and customer-service skills.
  • Strong organizational, time management, and analytical skills.
  • Ability to work independently and
  • Professional demeanor in all areas (e-mail, phone, in person).
  • Talent for communicating taxability laws and gross-up methodologies in layman’s terms.

Required Experience:

  • 5+ years relocation industry accounting experience.
  • Experience using MoveTrack by Ineo strongly preferred.
  • Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
  • Ability to analyze data and follow established procedures.
  • Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Reliable and disciplined to meet deadlines while working independently.
  • Dedicated to providing superior Customer Service to both external and internal clients.
Apply for job

items.content:
Application Method: CV and Covering Letter, both no more than 2 pages please. Any applications not adhering to this request will need to be disregarded.


Due to the high number of applications that we receive we are sadly unable to get back to everyone. If you haven’t heard from us by Friday 29th November 2019, it means that you haven’t been successful this time.


Semble is looking for an experienced project manager to lead on the delivery of high profile, purpose led projects and campaigns. 


 


● Do you have three or more years of clearly demonstrable experience delivering high profile projects or campaigns in a busy start-up environment


● Are you self-motivated, resilient, and with an (almost) endless engine of energy?


● Do you have a track record of working with existing clients and partners to develop new opportunities?


● Do you believe in the power of communities and organisations coming together and taking positive action to change the world?


If that’s four big ticks from you then you should definitely read on! If it isn't, please, please, please don't apply for this particular role. These are essential requirements, and we'd hate you to waste your time.


 


1. What is the purpose of this role?


Ultimately you will be responsible for delivering some of the high-profile campaigns and projects in Semble’s growing portfolio.


A close second to that will be a natural flair and passion for ensuring that Semble is constantly striving to be the best that it can possibly be.


Thirdly, you will also need to be comfortable with spotting new opportunities and developing those, with the support of the new business team.


 


2. What are the key responsibilities for this role?



  • To ensure campaigns and projects are delivered to time and to budget

  • To ensure contracts and finances are well managed

  • To report and evaluate impact of the campaigns

  • To ensure data is managed securely

  • To constantly strive to improve systems and processes

  • To ensure all partners are supported and kept up to date with the campaign as a whole 

  • Managing members of the delivery team


 


3. What are the minimum skills, knowledge and experience needed for this role?



  • A minimum of 2 years’ experience of leading on the end-to-end management of large purpose-led or change projects, campaigns or programmes

  • Experience of managing a diverse team, preferably including remote management

  • Experience of successfully developing relationships with external and internal clients and stakeholders at all levels

  • A clear and demonstrable understanding of what the challenges are when working for a small business or start-up

  • Experience of developing complex project plans and comfortable managing budgets and performance in a target driven environment

  • Experience of working within a tightly knit team, but needing to be largely self-motivated

  • Experience of developing and improving processes, tools and systems

  • Experience of using data for analysing and reporting on performance of a large campaign

  • Skilled at thinking creatively to develop new approaches and materials to further engage external stakeholders

  • Ability to manage own workload effectively 

  • Ability to manage a team and build effective processes

  • Ability to use initiative and draw on experience in dealing with day-to-day tasks, risks and challenges


 


Desirable skills, knowledge and experiences



  • Experience of data protection and GDPR

  • Experience within, or working with, the community sector

  • Knowledge or experience of marketing and communications theory and practise, particularly for digital.

  • Experience of fundraising or proposal writing

  • Experience of Theory of Change journey


 


4. About Semble and Our Community
Semble is the UK’s most active network of community projects with an online platform that currently hosts over 3,500 environmental and social projects. We connect community projects with local people and companies who want to help them to achieve their goals and join their story.


 


Our vision is: Bring people together to make a change


For the past six years, Semble has been growing its platform for community projects nationally and developing an impressive client base. We’re building the team, developing our brand and platform, and are now looking for someone to help us super-charge our community!


We run projects such as #Made Local, #GreenerwithGreggs (an environmental fund for Greggs), #GivexCollaborate (a team-based volunteering campaign for Dentsu Aegis Network), #YourPintCan (a neighbourhood investment fund for Carling), and Outdoor Classroom Day (a global day to get over 20m children outdoors to learn & play at school, in partnership with Unilever and a network of NGOs). Last year we ran the Offline Festival for community businesses.


 


5. Benefits & Further Details
In this role, you will be working closely with the Head of Campaigns and the campaigns team. You will have significant opportunities for personal development and play an important role in developing and nurturing our community.


We have a lot of fun, with drinks evenings, picnics & team away days. Community volunteering is actively encouraged with each team member having 2 days per year to volunteer, and at least 2 days to visit community projects to find out more about how Semble can help them, and to collect stories and content for social media and the Semble platform.


 


Other benefits include:
• £35,000 – £45,000 depending on experience
• Central London location, with option of working remotely for part of the time
• 25 days holiday allowance p.a.• 25 days holiday allowance p.a.
• Pension contribution
• Clear training opportunities and career path progression
• Discretionary bonus scheme, related to business performance
• Shared gym membership


No Recruitment Agencies please, you do a great job but we’ve got this one covered.

items.content:
Hand Tools, Garden, & General Writers Wanted (Long-Term & Consistent Work)

Company: HealthyHandyman
Location: Anywhere
Job Type: Freelance
Description

Hello!

We're looking for 3 different types of writers:

  • Home improvement writers - Writers with hands-on experience with various hand and power tools.
  • Garden writers
  • "General" writers - Talented writers that are good at researching, and writing about many different topics.

Other than running HealthyHandyman.com we have some other small blogs that we want to grow (in the form of awesome, informative articles).

Most of the work will entail:

  • Rewriting existing articles from scratch (some of them are not at the level we want them to be)
  • Writing new blog posts (we write a lot of 'How-To', 'X vs Y', and 'X Best' posts)

You don't have to be a professional in your topic, but you should have experience with the subject, and love writing about it.

In the future, the job may involve you having equipment in your hands, which you would test, review & take pictures of.

Specifics about the Position:

  • We're looking for a long-term hire (many months) and will provide you with 8,000 - 15,000 words of article writing per week (depending on how much you can do)
  • Work remotely (in your pajamas)
  • You'll be paid within 2 business days of submitting your completed work
  • Skype-based text communication only; no long, boring conference calls
  • Flexible: we respect your schedule and your work capacity

What's Required?

  • You must be a native English writer (We will find out if you don't have English as your first language when we go to pay you for your test assignment. Please do not apply if this is not the case. We will not pay.)
  • What's the capital of France. Please answer this question in the last field of the application.
  • A computer with internet access, Microsoft Word or Google Docs, Skype, and PayPal
  • Proper grammar and spelling is mandatory
  • Can use your research to create valuable, informative content that flows well
  • An understanding of how to speak to your audience properly
  • Must be punctual; you must reply on Skype within 24 hours, and always hit deadlines

Why choose us?

  • Lots of consistent, long-term work
  • Work remotely (in your pajamas)
  • You'll be paid fast
  • Skype-based text communication only; no long, boring conference calls
  • Flexible: we respect your schedule and your work capacity.

Head of Engineering - £90k-120k / equity available / partial remote available

An exciting task is waiting for you:

Shape the future of the technology and people working behind distributed personal data accounts! As our first Head of Engineering, your mission will be to build a high-profile, high-impact technology products and an attractive engineering culture together with our CTO. In close collaboration with the technical and product teams, you will define and architect our technical stack, write and review testable high quality code, shape our cross-functional development projects, ensure alignment across all tech-related projects and help shape our offering.

Your role in detail:

  • Leading and aligning our engineering projects

  • Scaling up the teams and operations through hiring and people development and supporting timely delivery of technical solutions to address business needs

  • Providing your teams with the best possible environment and selecting the optimum technical solutions for building and optimizing the technology stack

  • Advocating and advancing modern, agile software development practices and helping develop and evangelise great engineering and organisational practices

  • Evaluating outsourcing opportunities and strategy

  • Growing a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with the company values

  • Managing goals and expectations and creating a comprehensive and relevant OKR structure

What we definitely need:

  • A University degree in Computer Science or a related field (exceptions possible)

  • 5+ years’ experience in software engineering

  • 2+ years’ experience in leading, managing and coaching cross-functional teams

  • A solid experience working in an agile development environment

  • Proven experience in designing and implementing services on the cloud

  • Polyglot and full-stack understanding of technology

  • Passion for a clean and appropriately tested code

  • Strong analytical and critical thinking

  • Comfortable with uncertainty or ambiguity

  • Willingness and experience with both strategic and more detailed tasks

Extra bonus points for:

  • Hybrid cloud architecture experience

  • Previous experience with Scala or other functional programming languages

  • Familiarity with enterprise systems in a large corporation setting

What Dataswift stands for:

Dataswift provides personal data account solutions in the form of app-issued, user-owned infrastructure.

We believe the whole world’s been building apps and websites wrong. We’ve been storing user data and corporate data on the same servers, when we should have been storing user data on the user side. Company-owned user data is expensive and it’s pretty bad. It’s non-dynamic, non-representative, single-source information that costs every website and app in the world 23% of their engineering budget.

The Dataswift API-driven technology platform lets companies give user information back to their users, storing on user-owned infrastructure instead of on their corporate servers. They don’t have to change anything else about their app or technology in order to do this. Dataswift is working with dozens of companies around the world, including some of the largest pharmaceuticals and smallest, fastest-growing FinTechs.

Dataswift Culture & Values

Your impact: With your expertise and commitment you will actively shape our growth and the team itself! With our mission lock, the company is set to generate global social impact through changing the internet.

Teamwork: We pride ourselves on working around each other’s constraints. Need flexible hours due to childcare? We do that already. Need to work remotely part of the week due to personal commitments? We do that already.

Stable environment: We have just raised seed funding which will take us to the end of 2020 and we have guaranteed commitment from our investors on Series A funding if we successfully reach our goals in the next 16 months.

Growth: We have a 20% rule which means that we believe in learning through failure and growing by reaching for the stars so we expect to fail 20% of our goals.

The team’s favourite benefits:

  1. Remote working options

  2. Unlimited holiday

  3. Budget for personal development and training

  4. Countryside office if you prefer the peace and quiet of Cambridge countryside

  5. Regular team away days and bonding time

We believe in the diversity of our team and we don’t judge based on gender, sexual orientation, socio-economic background, history, culture, geography, nationality or any other possible discriminatory category. If you feel you don’t match every single specification, reach out to us at your.future.with@dataswift.io to discuss your options further.

Recruiters: We do not accept candidates through agencies. Please do not reach out to us as we are not interested in recruitment services at this moment in time.

Epistemic AI | VP Engineering | Remote (US Only) or New York | VISA | Full Time

At Epistemic AI we are building the next generation of tools to accelerate biomedical research with AI and NLP.

We are a group of world-renown scientists and engineers from the likes of Google, NASA, Two Sigma, New York University, and more. We are dedicated to enabling advances in biomedical research and practice with AI and NLP.

Our partners include some of the greatest biomedical institution in the world, and our scientific advisory board includes AI stars such as Andrew McCallum and Kyunghyun Cho.

We are creating a movement of people enthusiastically committed to a new vision for the future of biomedical research.

We are looking for an experienced engineering manager to join us as the VP of Engineering with the potential to become the company’s CTO. If you have 10+ years of professional software engineering experience and have spent a significant chunk of it managing engineering teams and orgs, we would like to hear from you.

Our technology stack is based on AWS (Cloud), Go (Infrastructure), Python 3, Tensorflow, Pytorch (NLP, ML, Deep Learning), AWS, Graph database), Typescript and React (Frontend). We have a CI/CD pipeline and a continuous release process. We train ML and NLP models on clusters of GPUs on Amazon and on Google Cloud TPUs.

If you're intrigued and want to come help advance biomedical research please drop us a line at jobs@epistemic.ai

items.content:
About the role


In this role you’ll be responsible for driving PROWLER.io marketing efforts including brand management and corporate identity, and developing, managing and measuring strategic marketing programs that deliver against PROWLER.io business objectives.


Reporting to the VP of Product & Marketing, you will manage the marketing team and work closely with the Head of Corporate Communications and other key stakeholders across the organisation to develop marketing strategies that drive awareness and demand for the PROWLER.io brand and product portfolio.


PROWLER.io is taking a different approach to the world of AI.


We’re not building a Go-beater or facial recognition software. We’re creating power-tools for people that will help them solve real-life business problems faster, enabling consistently better decision-making. And because our Machine Learning products don’t require big data or massive computing resources, we’re making it much more accessible. We can work with sparse information and can be implemented with a lean team. We need a marketer who can help us communicate that shift from the status-quo.


What you’ll be doing


Leading – You’ll build and manage a marketing organisation comprised of internal and agency resources. As part of this you’ll be setting and sticking to budgets, defining your team’s objectives, and getting everyone to deliver their best. 


Brand Development – We’re at an exciting juncture and will rely on you to see the company through this journey. It will be your responsibility to ensure the company’s identity, personality, and messaging are communicated consistently across all touchpoints.


Product Marketing – You will support and enable tight coordination of the Product Definition, Product Messaging, and Product Marketing. You will work with the Product Managers to help them develop products you’ll be excited to market.


Thought Leadership – Given our unique approach in this noisy space, you will be working with the Comms Team to highlight the companies leadership and messages.


Growth – Your team will work with our Business Development team to grow awareness, interest, engagement, and purchase across all channels. Key initiatives include – but certainly aren’t limited to – Events, Keynotes, Case Studies, Website, Blog, ABM, Email, SEO, SEM, Social.


Test & Scale – You will build a Marketing Lab to test different marketing investments – Paid-, Owned-, Earned-, Shared Media – and then scale them. You will define the metrics that matter, ensure accurate and timely tracking/reporting, and share key insights across the organisation. You will build relationships internally to leverage our ML models to help your team to do this.


What skills, experience, qualifications do you need to succeed in this role?


You’re curious about technology – You might not know much about AI or ML, but you’re dying to dig in and learn.


Ability to translate techno-speak – You’ve demonstrated the ability to soak up enough knowledge about deep tech and translate it into marketing that speaks to different audiences: CEOs to CTOs, GMs to Engineers, Investors, Analysts, Trade & Mainstream Press, and our own employees. Some of it needs to operate at a high level: plain English, simple. But you’ll also be reviewing some White Papers. 


You’re a scientist, a mind-reader, and an artist – You’re data-driven and run tests using hypothesis. You’re people-centric, building a deep empathy for our customers, partners, employees. 


You work with creative people – writers, designers, art-directors, web developers – to create clear and compelling stories and assets. You take pride in your ability to shift between your left and right brain.


You combine an enterprise toolkit with a startup mindset – You’ve led Marketing teams in larger organisations and are excited to help bring our new brand to life. There’s a lot of work to do, so you’ll want to be someone that thrives in a fast-paced environment. 


You’re a Thinker and a Doer – Strategic Direction, Messaging Constructs, Communication Plans are all things you’ll be developing, but you’ll equally love executing them just as much, as you’ll understand how best they’re done, you can build your org to support those functions. 


Experience – You’ll have significant experience in marketing leadership roles at B2B technology companies.


About Prowler.io


We are a world-class, cross-disciplinary team of researchers, engineers and product managers in Cambridge, UK, the global centre of AI excellence, combining branches of mathematics and engineering in ways that have never been done before. This integrated approach - and our industry-leading research credentials - gives us a unique competitive advantage.


We take pride in our diversity, valuing the experience and expertise that people from different backgrounds bring to our organisation. Our team of over 100 talented people from all over the globe consists of almost 30 different nationalities and we are growing. We are collaborative, innovative, ambitious, optimistic and curious.


We believe AI is valuable only when it enables better decisions. We want to ensure that business is powered by people; empowered by AI.


We offer flexible working opportunities as well as a competitive benefits package that includes company stock options, healthcare, various foodie goodies and a variety of other wellbeing options.

items.content:
We’re Airsorted. Our mission is to make hosting hassle-free for everyone.


We’ve grown fast. Since launching in 2015, we’ve signed up thousands of happy hosts, helping them to make over £60,000,000 in earnings.


The business has now expanded worldwide – we’re operating in over 20 cities globally, from Auckland to Lisbon, and there’s a lot more to come. Though we have three types of customers (hosts, guests and cleaners), we built the Airsorted product for our hosts. From holidaymakers to full-time landlords; host happiness is central to everything we do. 


As the business expands rapidly across the globe (currently 20+ markets; 30+ by EoY19), we need a customer-centric analytical brain to capture, define and implement best practice across all our markets.


Our mission is to build a global platform that makes it easy for everyone to share their home.


The Manchester Operations Manager’s role is to be fully accountable for the success of the local market and to support the Airsorted in its vision to build a global platform that makes it easy to share your home.


What will you be doing 



  • Grow Airsorted’s customer base in Manchester 

  • Plan, resource and lead the business to deliver on our customer promise (make it easy, deliver great value and build trust) 

  • Recruit, hire, support, and train a team that is capable of almost autonomous management of the local business

  • Focus limited resources on meaningful improvement of the product and service, continuously validating your assumptions

  • Cultivate relationships with key partners and suppliers to build defensible assets in the city.

  • Set the strategic and operational objectives of the local office and report against those objectives on a timely basis.


So what is your background like?



  • Experience managing operations with full autonomy and accountability. 

  • Experience of working in a high growth environment ideally at a startup.

  • Preferably has experience of managing a team

  • Preferably has experience of working remotely to their manager (who is based in London)

  • Preferably has experience of working with technology that has a real-world impact

  • High level of organisation and time management

  • Degree equivalent to 2:1 or above

  • Has an in depth knowledge of the city


What else do you get?



  • Highly competitive base salary, commensurate with the level of responsibility for this role.

  • Annual bonus (performance-based), and biannual pay reviews

  • Stock options– so when we make it big, so do you

  • 33 days paid holiday – plus an extra day off on your birthday (because who wants to work on their birthday)

  • Airbnb allowance – take a well-deserved break at an Airbnb property, on us

  • Enhanced Parental Leave – Family comes first. We offer great parental leave to spend time with your new child, regardless of your gender

  • Career development – unique opportunities to learn and progress in one of the UK’s leading startups

  • Enviable company culture – we’ve put time into getting our work culture just right. Regular team social events, company-wide recognition of outstanding work, free snacks and drinks every day – we’ve got it all    

  • Employee discounts – at heaps of restaurants, shops, gym memberships, cinema tickets and more

  • Pawternity leave – work from home for a week when you get a new pet, to help them settle in!

items.title: Head of Customer Experience
items.content:
Mirror. Signal. Career manoeuvre. Check.

 

Splend was created to give people from all walks of life the freedom to earn an income through driving. We’re looking for ambitious people, ready to join our journey and make a difference in people’s lives. 

 

We take great pride in our teams, who are as diverse as our members. We’re an industry-leading company looking for ambitious leaders who want to define the future – not just for on-demand driving, but for all of our members and each other.

 

The Role

 

We are looking for an exceptionally talented Head of Customer Experience who will work alongside our VP Operations and our global team as we continue on the exciting and challenging journey to a future where every on-demand driver can be successful.

 

You’ll be responsible for building the CX function by exploring what we have done to date, consolidating existing activities and building on this to create a category-leading customer experience.  This role should appeal if you are passionate about:

 


  • Building long-term competitive advantage through innovation and a superior customer experience

  • Developing knowledge and understanding of our customers to acquire and retain them, solve their problems, and improve lifetime value

  • Promoting the customer perspective and making sure it is reflected in our product, delivery and value proposition

  • Rigorously measuring the factors that drive the quality of customer experience

  • Building tools and metrics that contribute to data-driven decision-making

  • Promoting a customer-oriented culture





Responsibilities




    • Ultimate owner for everything customer-related

    • Create and manage a compelling customer experience vision

    • Balance trade-off between customer experience and cost-to-serve

    • Develop a CX strategy and drive it across the company

    • Provide input in key customer-related decisions in product development, marketing and branding

    • Create strategies for customer success and customer experience

    • Design, build and implement structures and processes for customer success, which will support company-wide customer acquisition, retention and customer value enhancement practices

    • Implement targeted campaigns to increase customer loyalty, retention, and satisfaction

    • Organise and implement customer feedback processes to establish deep customer knowledge (for the benefit of CX and also Product)Own customer service software / tools & resolution processes that will support the customer experience strategy

    • Help create a strong, customer-centric culture

    • Provide input into employee-engagement related initiatives

    • Define customer experience KPIs and cascade them across the org

    • Track and reach customer experience targets

    • Design, orchestrate, and improve customer experiences across interactions

    • Prioritise customer experience initiatives and episodes to be improved

    • Ensure consistent customer delivery

    • Ensure alignment of back-end systems to support customer strategy







Requirements




    • Great academic track record at leading schools

    • Minimum five years’ experience in operational roles in startups or scaleups, ideally operating across more than one geographic location

    • Experience building analytical, data-driven, processes

    • Ability to operate with autonomy

    • Someone who is comfortable operating at high speed (maybe breaking things occasionally, but always fixing them and learning from the experience)

    • Strong commercial, customer-centric and deeply resourceful thinking

    • Analytical, logical, obsessed with detail and process

    • Ability to interact and work in a creative, cross-functional, global team

    • Must be excited by the scale and complexity of the challenge, driven by ambitious goals and willing to do anything to make them happen

    • Desirable, but not mandatory; previous roles in a Customer Experience team at a later stage business, or managing the team at a smaller business






Culture and Rewards

 

Most places split these sections into two, but we only need two sentences to describe the culture at Splend.

 

We work hard for our members, and we celebrate our achievements. Nothing great happens in isolation, and so we simultaneously push and support one another to identify uncharted realms of greatness.

 

So how about it? You want in? Click the 'Apply' button!

 

Splend does not, under any circumstances, make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of any prohibited ground, including but not limited to race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender-identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable local, provincial, or federal laws or prohibited by Company policy.

 

Splend is committed to a healthy, safe and inviting work environment where harassment of any kind will not be tolerated.

 

If you haven't heard back from us within 30 days, please assume you have been unsuccessful on this occasion.

items.content:
Why Deliveroo?
When you first think about Deliveroo, you probably think of getting great food to your house in less than half an hour. Awesome right? But behind the scenes is the real story. This story is one of high growth, huge challenges and an enormous opportunity ahead of us. It began with our founder Will, arriving in London over 5 years ago and finding it almost impossible to order great food, despite the wealth of incredible restaurants in the city. Fast forward 5 years and we operate in 13 countries with over 50,000 riders who deliver orders from 50,000 restaurants in over 200 cities worldwide.


We want to be the definitive food company - the app you go to any time you have a hunger pang. We are already transforming the way people think about food, providing people with limitless access to different cuisines and restaurants, turning cooking from a chore to a choice, and giving people the freedom to eat what they want, when they want, where they want it.


We work with riders, restaurants and consumers. We operate one of the most complex marketplaces in the world and we do this in real time. Millions of customers and thousands of restaurants and riders rely on us to match them within milliseconds. The algorithms behind that marketplace are the secret sauces that allow us to deliver our orders in under 30 minutes.


And we’re just getting started.


The scale of the opportunity ahead of us is immense. The global food market is valued at £7.7 trillion but only 1% of it is currently online. Contrast that with the digital disruption of countless other industries - from banking and travel to retail and communications - it’s clear that our journey in the food sector has only just begun.


We are already a multi-billion dollar company that is more than doubling in size every year. Deliveroo came top in the FT’s’ list of Europe’s fastest growing 1000 companies in 2018, and we were the first company ever to win Deloitte’s ‘UK Top 50’ two years in a row. Yet most of the extraordinary value this company will generate lies ahead of us.


About the Production Platform Group
The production platform group build, maintain and secure services, tooling and infrastructure that is relied upon by the rest of the company to provide excellent service to our customers, riders and restaurants.


Furthermore, the teams all play a consultancy role to the other product engineering teams, evangelizing and helping the adoption of said services, tools and infra as well as helping to build reliability guidelines.


Responsibilities:
There are three core areas; planning, communications and engineering processes.


Day to day:



  • Work with the engineers to build a roadmap, prioritize and execute the backlog

  • Track issues and find solutions for programme problems as they arise

  • Stakeholder management: This is a critical role for Deliveroo to make sure both external and internal teams are working toward the same goal and managing communication & changes. You’ll need to advocate for all stakeholders throughout the program to ensure they have the support needed to succeed

  • Process optimisation: It’s essential that we continue to learn. You’ll be responsible for identifying where we can improve, and making sure that we execute required changes across teams

  • Workflow improvement: You will work closely with your team to define and maintain work practices, tools and guidelines across the team


Skills include:



  • Passion for working with devops and infrastructure teams

  • Interpersonal skills to build relationships, and collaborate with diverse geographically distributed teams

  • Manage multiple facets of a large-scale project and track progress

  • Work on many tasks at once, which makes multitasking skills a must-have

  • Solve problems to keep multiple programmes of work on track

  • Work effectively in a constantly evolving and ambiguous environment


Experience:



  • 3+ years of industry experience as a Technical Programme Manager

  • Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges to all org levels

  • Incident management experience


Life at Deliveroo
We are a growing team, with a very large impact, seeking to solve some of the most interesting challenges out there. We move fast, we’re always looking for new ideas and the entire company is very transparent about the decisions we make and why we make them.


There are so many questions we need to answer and plenty more we haven’t even encountered. How do data and technology help restaurants to grow as consumer habits change? How can we predict what someone wants to order for dinner long before the idea has even crossed their mind? At Deliveroo these are just some of the tough problems we are solving - and there is no challenge that cannot be yours to work on. No solution is owned by a particular team, which means the scope for growth and personal impact is enormous.


Benefits and Diversity
At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. We offer a wide range of competitive benefits in areas including health, family, finance, community, convenience, growth, time away and relocation.


In 2018 we announced our decision to give every employee equity in the company. We did this because we wanted all of our employees, regardless of location, level or role, to be owners and because we believe that this is the right thing to do. We believe this helps build a culture where everyone is committed and able to share in the company’s success.


We believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest growing start-ups around.

DESCRIPTION


Who are Opensignal?

Opensignal, a mobile analytics company, is the global standard for measuring real-world mobile network experience. Using billions of measurements collected 24/7 from tens of millions of smartphones, we analyze real-world mobile network experience at the largest scale and frequency in the wireless industry. We believe measuring how the network performs directly through users’ eyes is key to building better wireless networks. Our insights are used across the industry by mobile operators, telecoms regulators, equipment manufacturers and analysts. We have done business across six continents and have driven press headlines in 80 countries, in an industry impacting the lives of billions around the world.


Founded in 2010, Opensignal is a high-growth global company harnessing the power of mobile technologies and big data analytics to redefine how the mobile industry measures network performance. We’re part of theGlobal Telecoms ‘Power 100’, TechCity Future Fifty, and backed by an impressive portfolio of investors.


Having doubled our employee base to 60 at the beginning of 2019, we plan to grow beyond 80 by the end of 2019, to help drive our vision further. We're headquartered in London, UK, where you’ll find most of our employees, who we like to call 'Opensignalers', but the teams you'll work with are global. A truly international team, our ‘Opensignalers’ work acrossfour continents, and represent over 25 nationalities.


Find out more by visiting our website.


Purpose of the role


We have seen our revenues grow significantly over the last few years. To help fuel the growth, we have recently developed several innovative, unique offerings to our marketplace.


As a result, we are hiring our first Inside Sales team. This new team will work alongside the existing global sales team, helping them drive revenues, increase their effectiveness in the marketplace and enhance our global position as the independent global standard on mobile network experience.


A vital part of the new Inside Sales function will be to maintain and execute sales campaigns to the top ‘C’ level executives at Mobile Operators across Europe, Asia Pacific and North and South America. As the role will have a genuine global focus, you’ll be working across multiple time zones.


It is a great time to join as you’ll be at the beginning of our Inside Sales initiative, you’ll get exposure throughout the company and be at the forefront of driving and increasing our revenues and presence in the marketplace.


 


As Sales Development Manager, you will be responsible for:



  • Outbound lead generation and selling of Opensignal proposition to named target Mobile Operators and Regulators

  • Research and verify contact details for target ‘C’ level executives in target accounts and manage contacts in Opensignal CRM system

  • Establish and administer executive communication with Mobile Operators and Regulators within target markets

  • Promote Opensignal public reports and analysis to targeted Mobile Network Operators

  • Follow up with targeted executives to promote Opensignal’s value propositions

  • Manage inbound leads appropriately following standard process and in a timely manner

  • Qualify leads and nature of interest in Opensignal – pass to field sales or remotely execute direct sale of the Opensignal entry-level solutions

  • Adhere to Opensignal operating principles, methodology and brand standards

  • Working with product management/sales leadership to maintain Opensignal low-level entry product collateral to support outbound marketing/sales

  • Use Opensignal CRM system to track opportunities and distribute leads (close.io)

  • Work closely with field sales leaders, sales management, marketing and product marketing to support company sales objectives and to optimise team effectiveness.

  • Evolve and execute the process and practice for effective sales development, in support of revenue growth for Opensignal

  • Report on activity and results weekly and quarterly to senior management


This role will require time spent in our Global HQ in London, but many responsibilities can be conducted remotely. Flexible working hours will be required due to the time zones involved.




REQUIREMENTS


What we need from you



  • An enthusiastic, self-starter who can hit the ground running

Relish was founded in July 2018 by Lesley Eccles, who previously founded FanDuel, (one of Scotland’s largest consumer companies which she grew to over 500 employees and a user base of over 6m customers). Relish closed a seed round of funding at the end of 2018 from Trinity Ventures (a long established Silicon Valley VC firm).


 


Relish is tranforming the relationship advice space with the first-ever truly personalized relationship training app that makes it easy to build a happy, healthy, more connected relationship.


 


Relish is currently only available in the US. Having achieved App of the Day in the US App Store in August 2019, before it even officially launched, this is your chance to get in at the ground floor with a category defining product that is changing the way people live.


 





















We’re looking for a deeply talented product manager who can:




  • Own and further develop the Relish product strategy, build a roadmap to get there, and prioritise the work to deliver it based on key business goals




  • Work creatively to evaluate and analyse areas of the product using data and user insights to solve problems




  • Oversee product development from concept, prototype, specification, design, development, testing, launch, and iteration




  • Maintain a harmonious and productive rhythm between engineering, design, and non-technical stakeholders through good communication and stakeholder management




Reporting directly to the CEO, your day-to-day responsibilities will include:




  • Work closely with the Lead Engineer and CEO to develop and refine high level product strategy




  • Assess value, prioritise stories and areas of work to ensure focus is on those with maximum value and aligned to product strategy.




  • Lead planning, facilitate team conversations, help break work into iterative releases, create and own product release plans and set expectations for delivery.




  • Prioritise and groom the product feature backlog, and also keep track of stakeholder requests, bugs and iterations.




  • Capture and refine product requirements, including analytic events and design requirements




  • Ensure that the team always has an adequate amount of prepared tasks ready to work on.




You will have these skills:




  • Strong project management and organisational skills;




  • Ability to focus on the big picture in terms of what will move the metrics;




  • Attention to detail with excellent follow through skills;




  • Able to deal with multiple priorities or tasks at once;




  • A practical attitude and be adept at problem solving;




  • Strong communicative skills, both written and verbal, and ability to push back;




  • Strong analytical skills to understand how customers are using the product;




  • Knowledge of mobile app development and release processes.




  • Knowledge of Amplitude is a bonus




Who are you likely to be?


You’re an experienced product manager: You have at least 5 years of experience in a similar role, for a consumer technology product. You know how to develop and test ideas, and how to analyse the results to understand the impact of changes


You’re strategic: You’re data-driven and highly analytical. You prioritise strategic choices, over just releasing features. And you know when and when not to go with your gut


You’re creative: You have vision and the skills to communicate your vision and inspire the team, you approach problems with creative thinking.


You can hit the ground running, with experience of working in a startup: You’re willing to do a bit of everything and get your hands dirty (by dirty, we mean anything from providing customer support, QA, to writing in app copy, so not *that* dirty)


You’re agile and able to deal with change: You have experience with agile delivery and development practices but are not devoted to any particular one. You can deal with changes in priority like water off a duck’s back.


You value simplicity: You understand that less is often more. You find the fastest path to deliver maximum value to user.


You are at home with data: You can define success metrics, analyse and monitor features and suggest improvements based on results


You are user-centric: You care about user experiences and are the voice of the customer for the product. You value user feedback, understand user testing best practices, and user-insights inform your decisions.


You have a sense of humour: In case we had to remind you, you’re a team player. You like the people you work with, you might even go for lunch once in a while. :)


 


Why would you want to work with us:


Besides working with a group of cool people, you’ll also get:




  • Professional and personal development – we have a budget for training, conferences, online tutorials etc. We want to make sure we’re creating a learning culture from the outset for everyone




  • Flexible work hours – we don’t focus on being in the office 9-5, you know when you work best




  • Working alongside an incredibly strong, high-performing team




  • Working on a product which not only has massive user growth potential, but also the potential for making a huge positive impact on society




  • Full holiday allowance (25 days + bank holidays)




  • Highly competitive salary




  • Pension (5% contribution from the company)




  • Equity in the company




  • The best equipment and software to go about executing your day-to-day work




  • Relocation package (if required)

About us:


Crozdesk.com runs software marketplaces and comparison sites helping businesses globally decide on which software solutions to use. From CRM to Accounting and Marketing Automation to Supply Chain Management - we cover 250+ categories of business software and compare almost everything for our users! Our vendor solutions portal helps thousands of software companies connect with their ideal customers.


We have a dynamic team that's distributed globally with our head office (4 - 5 people) based in Shoreditch, London - which is where you will be located.


If you like a collaborative and productive environment in which responsibilities are shared and where you'll come in contact with all aspects of the business, you'll fit right in.


The role:


We are looking for an entrepreneurial self-starter, with a hands-on attitude and a knack for details. You will work on a new program that we are currently piloting that helps software buyers find the information they need through dynamically generated recommendation reports and seamless vendor introductions. You will work with partners, software vendors, users and technical colleagues to refine, test, tweak and scale this digital matchmaking machine. You will run campaigns to promote the program, build new partnerships and develop your own ideas to scale the new program through our marketplaces and wider partner network.


The role sits at the intersection between marketing, sales, product management, customer success and program strategy. Since you will be the point person on this, the program’s success is your success. You will get the chance to earn a bonus and get stock options in line with the program performance. If you are a versatile individual who’s up for a challenge, this role is right for you.


Requirements:



  • 1.5+ years of marketing, operations or sales experience in B2B tech and/or startups

  • A Bachelor's degree or above with a demonstrable interest in business, technology, statistics or analytics

  • A keen understanding of the SaaS / software market and marketplaces in general

  • Experience working with CRMs, planning and implementing sales and marketing strategies and dealing with B2B clients

  • Experience working with large datasets (Excel, Google Sheets, etc)

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • The ability to foster and grow client relationships

  • An entrepreneurial mindset and good technical acumen


We offer competitive salaries, a direct and uncapped bonus structure based on the program performance, attractive stock options and pension benefits - all of which will scale with the impact you have on our business. Your base salary will depend on your level of experience and overall skillset.


Base: £25K – £35K    Bonus: based on program performance


Stock Options: based experience and probation performance


Join us at Crozdesk and become part of our fast-paced, close-knit team in a flexible role with plenty of responsibilities and room for growth!

items.content:
Accounts Development Manager





MySense celebrated our third birthday this October and as a present to ourselves we want to hire the greatest Accounts Manager in the world. We are creating a global movement here, not just a great business. We have an outstanding product that solves a major problem for a huge number of people across the world in an attractive and convenient way. The delight in people’s faces when they see and touch our product, or picture it in their home helping a loved one isn’t just technology for technology’s sake, it’s a real solution. We also have an outstanding team, every single one of them is with us from the start and committed to the future. And we have outstanding customers and partners, working together with us to build something that actually changes people’s lives.


 


Salary £60K - £75K





About the role


This is a new role, created at MySense (UK) Ltd to drive new growth, successfully deliver current and potential opportunities across the UK, and annual sales revenues exceeding £20m.


MySense has ambitious plans in the UK and internationally: to move beyond current markets (UK and Canada) to at least one other, and to create opportunities to sell down additional verticals in the UK and new markets over the next five years.


Our customers in the UK are Public Sector, Accommodation Providers, Care and Support Providers and Property Developers. This role will further advance our strategy and channel partnerships down all market verticals. The role will also play a key part in shaping and delivering an exciting B2B2C retail offer.


This is a role that needs exceptional account management, both strategically and operationally. In some cases, this will involve challenging client-side dialogue and issue resolution. This role is not one for someone seeking an ivory tower; MySense team members lead from the front and by example in order to go above and beyond to ensure customer satisfaction without compromising our product.


In the short term, this role will operationalise account delivery strategies, including the utility of the product and whether the majority of the devices work as designed, proving we add value to the users/families to make sure we retain customers and have those customers enthusiastically recommend the product.


An empathy with partner businesses and their business models, to help us and them sell our product, and to establish what our business model should look like to add value is critical to this role. This will include (but is not limited to) creating and administering a reseller program, training and building in-house capacity out in the field and building additional pipelines, rather than traditional BD / sales.


The Accounts Manager will report to the Chief Commercial Officer of MySense Group, and be based in Westminster Tower, London.





Responsibilities:



  • Build strategies and execute them through tactical implementation of coherent and commercially strong plans that continually grow the customer base and increase revenue

  • Build new executive-level relationships, generating leads, driving the sales pipeline and introducing potential new growth opportunities

  • Contribute to the MySense customer experience and the brand touch-points, nationally and internationally

  • Contribute to building the internal culture of the organisation required as we scale-up: not creepy corporate or lava lamp cliche but our own identity and behaviours consistent with the MySense way

  • Build the internal capacity to successfully fulfil large scale contracts: so this aspect requires exceptional programme delivery experience, account leadership (not just management; but services and development, and often strategic leadership to/from client side)

  • Build and test a sustainable distribution model for high volume roll out across UK markets

  • Build (i.e. spec and recruit to) our UK sales and marketing function

  • Contribute to the plan for retail at Group level and present a fully worked-up model for the UK within 12 months





Role Requirements:



  • 3+ years of domain experience and a proven track record of exceeding objectives

  • The ability to work with a focus on deadlines and business goals

  • Possess a valid driver’s license and suitable vehicle - must be willing to travel

  • Endless curiosity and active listening with a passion for learning and solutions

  • A master at maintaining positive client relationships, even through difficult dialogue

  • The ability to ensure programmes of delivery meet the needs of buyer and seller

  • Ability to create successful long term partnerships across verticals and industries

  • Charismatic team leader, internal champion and values based manager of people






About the successful candidate


The Accounts Manager will own the end to end delivery of the commercial strategy for the UK.


The successful candidate will possess domain knowledge across most if not all current market verticals, with particular sensitivity for both the strategic operational environments of our channel partners and their clients.


Calm under pressure and with exemplary client facing skills, the successful candidate will represent MySense with professionalism and integrity, openness and honesty. It goes without saying that delivering projects to tight deadlines with customer focus and product discipline will form a key accountability.





Culture and Personality:



  • Willing to work hard but also have fun

  • Good sense of humour

  • Entrepreneurial spirit

  • Innovative and open-minded

  • Tenacious problem-solver

  • Proactive self-starter

  • Able to work as part of a wider team

  • An appetite for learning

  • A passion for technology of all types

  • An interest in health and wellbeing

  • Enjoys a social office atmosphere

  • An appetite to achieve great things and to help many vulnerable people remain independent in their own homes





Benefits:



  • 30 days holiday + your birthday + Public Holidays

  • Fruit, Coffee, Tea and breakfast all are in office

  • Remote working possible

  • Private Health Insurance

  • Life Insurance

  • Pension scheme

  • Office dog (hypoallergenic)

  • Relaxed startup environment - your input matters

  • Company laptop





About MySense


MySense is a wellbeing analytics platform built on compassion, by people who understand what it’s like to care for a loved one. But we’re also a team of dedicated (self-proclaimed) nerds, tech is what we know and love. So, we have combined these two drives and created a product we can be proud of.


The idea is that peace of mind about a loved one’s wellbeing should be at people’s fingertips no matter who or where they are. To do this, we created a wearable device and 11 sensors that can be placed around someone’s home. Each sensor picks up information about a key activity. This means looking at drinking and eating habits, toilet usage, sleep patterns and heart rate (approximately 5,000 data points). These sensors collect data that our AI then analyses for any patterns of decline in wellbeing. When we start to notice that something isn’t looking ideal, we send caregivers notifications so they can address problems before they escalate.


 


Check us out:


https://www.mysense.ai


https://www.linkedin.com/company/mysense


 


We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

Head of Engineering - £90k-120k / equity available / partial remote possible 


An exciting task is waiting for you:


Shape the future of the technology and people working behind distributed personal data accounts! As our first Head of Engineering, your mission will be to build a high-profile, high-impact technology products and an attractive engineering culture together with our CTO. In close collaboration with the technical and product teams, you will define and architect our technical stack, write and review testable high quality code, shape our cross-functional development projects, ensure alignment across all tech-related projects and help shape our offering.


Your role in detail:



  • Leading and aligning our engineering projects

  • Scaling up the teams and operations through hiring and people development and supporting timely delivery of technical solutions to address business needs

  • Providing your teams with the best possible environment and selecting the optimum technical solutions for building and optimizing the technology stack

  • Advocating and advancing modern, agile software development practices and helping develop and evangelise great engineering and organisational practices

  • Evaluating outsourcing opportunities and strategy

  • Growing a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with the company values

  • Managing goals and expectations and creating a comprehensive and relevant OKR structure


 


What we definitely need:



  • A University degree in Computer Science or a related field (exceptions possible)

  • 5+ years’ experience in software engineering

  • 2+ years’ experience in leading, managing and coaching cross-functional teams

  • A solid experience working in an agile development environment

  • Proven experience in designing and implementing services on the cloud

  • Polyglot and full-stack understanding of technology

  • Passion for a clean and appropriately tested code

  • Strong analytical and critical thinking

  • Comfortable with uncertainty or ambiguity

  • Willingness and experience with both strategic and more detailed tasks


Extra bonus points for:



  • Hybrid cloud architecture experience

  • Previous experience with Scala or other functional programming languages

  • Familiarity with enterprise systems in a large corporation setting


 


What Dataswift stands for:


Dataswift provides personal data account solutions in the form of app-issued, user-owned infrastructure.


We believe the whole world’s been building apps and websites wrong. We’ve been storing user data and corporate data on the same servers, when we should have been storing user data on the user side. Company-owned user data is expensive and it’s pretty bad. It’s non-dynamic, non-representative, single-source information that costs every website and app in the world 23% of their engineering budget.


The Dataswift API-driven technology platform lets companies give user information back to their users, storing on user-owned infrastructure  instead of on their corporate servers. They don’t have to change anything else about their app or technology in order to do this. Dataswift is working with dozens of companies around the world,  including some of the largest pharmaceuticals and smallest, fastest-growing FinTechs.


 


Dataswift Culture & Values


Your impact: With your expertise and commitment you will actively shape our growth and the team itself! With our mission lock, the company is set to generate global social impact through changing the internet. 


Teamwork: We pride ourselves on working around each other’s constraints. Need flexible hours due to childcare? We do that already. Need to work remotely part of the week due to personal commitments? We do that already. 


Stable environment: We have just raised seed funding which will take us to the end of 2020 and we have guaranteed commitment from our investors on Series A funding if we successfully reach our goals in the next 16 months. 


Growth: We have a 20% rule which means that we believe in learning through failure and growing by reaching for the stars so we expect to fail 20% of our goals. 


 


The team’s favourite benefits:



  1. Remote working options 

  2. Unlimited holiday

  3. Budget for personal development and training

  4. Countryside office if you prefer the peace and quiet of Cambridge countryside

  5. Regular team away days and bonding time


We believe in the diversity of our team and we don’t judge based on gender, sexual orientation, socio-economic background, history, culture, geography, nationality or any other possible discriminatory category. If you feel you don’t match every single specification, reach out to us at your.future.with@dataswift.io to discuss your options further.


Reach out to us on AngelList to hear more!


Recruiters: We do not accept candidates through agencies. Please do not reach out to us as we are not interested in recruitment services at this moment in time.

Director of Engineering - Perm - New York, NY Responsibilities: * Day to day management of the DevOps and IT/IS teams * Deployment of all platform software * Maintaining the production environment * The management of all high value/high availability systems requiring 24/7 monitoring * You will be the de facto leader of the Sustaining Team * Building engineering process and workflows * Building project plans for the deployment of all IT projects * Leading the negotiation of all software contracts * Process documentation * Customer facing communications (escalations) Leadership Requirements: * Stay focused on customer and market needs * Develop a culture of openness and team-work * Communicate and translate the clients' vision into goals for multiple Software Engineering teams * Support organizational capacity through staffing, budgeting, compensation planning, skills development, and acquisition of required tools and technologies * Collaborate effectively across all functions to ensure organizational effectiveness * Handle escalations that cannot be resolved independently by direct reports, and may similarly escalate to more senior management as appropriate * Balance available resources to support the objectives of multiple teams * Expert understanding of underlying technology, product and product domain, to participate effectively in technical and release discussions Requirements: * Has previously managed 5+ direct engineering reports and a total engineering staff of 10-20 employees * Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field is required * Must have previously led a Sustaining Team, or similar role * Experience with automation, and the leadership of a CI/CD pipeline * 10 or more years of leadership experience within the software domain Why Hays? You will be working with a professional recruiter who has intimate knowledge of the Information Technology industry and market trends . Your Hays recruiter will lead you through a thorough screening process in order to understand your skills, experience, needs, and drivers. items.title: DockYard: Director of Project Management (Remote)
items.content:
Director of Project Management (Remote)

Full-time
Anywhere
Remote job
Small business
Posted Oct 17 – Accepting applications

Who We Are

DockYard is a 100% remote software consultancy that specializes in web applications. We have in-house designers, developers, and project managers, and we are looking for a Director of Project Management to join our growing team. You’ll work alongside talented individuals on groundbreaking projects for the world’s largest companies.

 

What We Do

We help ambitious companies transform new ideas into fully deployed web applications. Our clients range from seed funded and early stage startups, who depend on us to define and deliver business-critical workflows, to established enterprise companies seeking fresh perspective and deep expertise on new projects.

The ideal candidate is a champion for diversity and inclusion, is self-driven, team-oriented, passionate about web technologies and industry best practices, and has experience managing projects and people with exceptional results.

What It’s Like To Work Here 

We offer a comprehensive benefit plan with a focus on providing an exceptional working environment. Some of these benefits include:

 

  • 100% Remote workforce
  • 100% DockYard paid medical, dental, vision, life & AD&D starting Day 1
  • 401(k) offered through Vanguard
  • Substantial paid time off
  • Conference & Laptop stipend

Responsibilities

 

This position reports directly to the Managing Director of Client Services and will be a member of DockYard leadership team.

 

  • Develop/drive vision for Project Management discipline at DockYard
  • Collaboration with cross-discipline leadership team in building a world-class client services agency
  • Manage the Project Management team including, but not limited to: performance management, employee training and development, mentoring, recruitment and onboarding.
  • Drive continuous improvement and guide Project Management team on industry standards and best practices.
  • Direct the Project Management department including budgeting and project resource allocation, development of organizational metrics (as applicable) and reporting.
  • Ensure Project Management team is able to stay on target by removing obstacles to their success.
  • Partner with Business Development for bid proposals and client communications as needed.
  • Act as point person for and address any project management issues or concerns that arise.
  • Ability to reveal/identify potential Biz Dev opportunities to management team.
  • Fill in as a Senior Project Manager as needed to support ebbs and flows of client work and/or internal projects.

Must Haves 

 

  • 2+ years experience fulfilling Director of Project Management or Director of Product responsibilities in an agency environment
  • 7+ years of experience in managing products and/or software teams
  • Demonstrated people management experience
  • Proven understanding of what it means to be a Servant Leader
  • Experience working in Scrum and/or other types of Agile environments
  • Business Development experience
  • Ability to develop and maintain strong client relationships
  • Experience working/managing people in a remote work environment
  • Willingness to evangelize DockYard’s approach to Project Management via blogs, speaking opportunities, PM community outreach
  • Willingness to travel up to 15% of the time

 

This role is a U.S.-based remote position. No visa sponsorship is available for this position.

DockYard is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, political affiliation, personal appearance, pregnancy, family responsibilities, matriculation, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state, or local law.

items.content:
Head of Engineering

Hopin (www.hopin.to) is a live video events platform that brings people together online. Our mission is to provide better connections for a better world through interactive and personal online events.

We’ve recently been funded by Seedcamp, Europe’s best early stage VC and are at an inflection point in regards to pace of growth. We’re currently in private beta with an over 5000+ waitlist and looking to scale really fast.

With significant early traction we're working towards building our in-house product & engineering team to be the heartbeat that drives the company forward. (Our aim is to be the fastest growing startup in Europe in 2020).

About the role:

We’re looking for a Head of Engineering to build out the tech team, lead and take part in decisions that will ultimately contribute to the future direction of the business.

You will have the opportunity to work within a highly motivated and ambitious team of 6, reporting directly to the CEO & Founder. 

The Head of Engineering should have:
  • Solid Ruby on Rails experience and front-end experience
  • 5+ years’ experience in software engineering
  • 2+ years’ experience in leading and managing cross-functional teams
  • A solid experience working in an agile development environment
  • Polyglot and full-stack understanding of technology
  • Passion for a clean and appropriately tested code
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking

Other relevant skills:
  • Strong background in technology selection & application design
  • Strong understanding of different software development practices & infrastructure, and how each can help ship more value to customers, quicker
  • Proven experience building & nurturing an engineering team
  • High standards, and the pragmatism to understand when to apply them
  • Happy to be hands-on whilst the engineering team grows (our stack is Ruby on Rails/React)
  • Startup/new product experience

Extra bonus points for:
  • Experience with WebRTC, Live Streaming or other related video technologies
  • Willingness to consider managing a fully remote engineering team if decided

More about Hopin:

Hopin solves the problem with webinars and virtual events. Webinars are one-sided and passive; participants don’t interact with each—a critical component to learning. Unlike Zoom and other video conferencing tools, Hopin focuses on engagement and interaction between users (people-centric), not on screen-watching (powerpoint-centric). 
 
With Hopin, organizers can build live video events with a Stage (for presentations to hundreds of thousands of people), Sessions (for group breakout discussions of up to ten people), and Networking (for one-on-one meetings). 
 
The offer:

A competitive starting salary for this role with opportunity to revisit constantly as we scale + equity.




We are currently a remote team, so are open to remote applications from all over the world. However, if you’re based in London you can work with the CEO at the Seedcamp office in the Google for Startups Campus in Shoreditch. 

If you’re interested in applying for this role, please reach out with your resume.
